result.execSummary:
The defendant Amada A Fuentes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund
4/5/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Amada A Fuentes in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

AS TO COUNT 1:

On Motion of the State,  Court ordered count 1 DISMISSED and READ-IN for the purposes of Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.04(2t), a class U Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve NINE (9) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for NINE(9) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court WAIVED all costs, fees and surcharges in the interest of Society.

Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay all associated costs.  DNA assessment to be paid by 03-29-2018 WITHOUT Tax Intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Due to the unavailability of the Court,  matter is RESCHEDULED to 03-29-2016 at 08:30 am.  sdg

Defendant Amada A Fuentes in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter heard off the Record.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Amada A Fuentes in court with Attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights,  Addendum and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction DEFERRED for SIX (6) months by the Court and the entry of judgment and sentencing until the review date.  
The defendant agrees to complete certain conditions.  If the defendant completes these conditions, the state will amend the charge to Misdemeanor Fleeing and leave the amount of the forfeiture up to the court.  If the defendant does not complete the conditions, the parties will be free to argue as to sentencing on the review date.
The conditions are as follows:
*Defendant to complete an AODA and Mental Health Examination and cooperate with any treatment.
*Defendant to undergo random screens for drugs and alcohol to ensure absolute sobriety.
*Defendant to obtain.maintain employment 
*Defendant to attend Parenting Classes and/or cooperate with Children's Court Center.
*Defendant waives his right to a jury trial
*Defendant waives his right to confrontation and his right to compulsory attendance of witnesses
*Defendant waives his right to a speedy jury trial
*Defendant to be monitored by Justice Point
*Defendant to commit no new crimes that rise to the level of probable cause.
*Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Store, 9035 S Howell AVenue in Oak Creek, or Gary Peckman.
*Defendant to have driver's license revoked for SIX (6) months.
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges from bail on deposit.
*Defendant to pay $50 to monitoring agency, Justice Point.  
Case adjourned for review in Branch 33 on December 1, 2015 at 1:30pm, Judge Ashley's court.

FILED, Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement, received.

Defendant Amada A Fuentes in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Oak Creek Police Officer Andrew Ahearn.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Amada A Fuentes in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Amada A Fuentes in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
